org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure

Class InfrastructureManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure.InfrastructureManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, NodeSourcePlugin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchJobInfrastructure, DefaultInfrastructureManager, HostsFileBasedInfrastructureManager, LocalInfrastructure

    public abstract class InfrastructureManager
extends Object
implements NodeSourcePlugin
    Represents underlying infrastructure and defines ways to acquire / release nodes.
    Acquisition requests are supposed to be asynchronous. When new new node is available it should register itself into the resource manager by calling internalRegisterAcquiredNode(Node)
    To define a new infrastructure manager - define a way to add information about further node acquisition implementing configure(Object...) - define a way to acquire a single node from underlying infrastructure in acquireNode() - define a way to acquire all available nodes from the infrastructure in the method acquireAllNodes() - register available nodes in the resource manager using internalRegisterAcquiredNode(Node), so they till be taken into account. - add the name of new class to the resource manager configuration file (config/rm/nodesource/infrastructures).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • persistedInfraVariables

        protected Map<String,Serializable> persistedInfraVariables
        Store information about the running infrastructure. The map holds the name of monitored information and its value. The variables stored in this map should allow the full recovery of an infrastructure state. All accesses to this map must be synchronized.

      • readLock

        protected transient Lock readLock
        Use this lock to wrap a read access to runtime variables

        protected transient Lock writeLock
        Use this lock to wrap a write access to runtime variables

      • internalNotifyDownNode

        public void internalNotifyDownNode(String nodeName,
                                   String nodeUrl,
                                   org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
                            throws RMException
        This method is called by the system when a Node is detected as DOWN.
        Parameters:
        node - the ProActive Programming Node that is down. This parameter can be null if no information about the node can be retrieved apart from its url.
        nodeUrl - the URL of the node that is down.
        Throws:
        RMException - if any problems occurred.

      • internalRegisterAcquiredNode

        public final RMDeployingNode internalRegisterAcquiredNode(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
                                                   throws RMException
        This method is called by the RMCore to notify the InfrastructureManager that a new node was added to the core. If the IM throws an exception, the node is not added. Note that this method is in mutual exclusion with checkNodeIsAcquiredAndDo(String, Runnable, Runnable) At this point, if a previous call to addDeployingNode(String, String, String, long) was made (means that implementor uses deploying nodes features), this method ensures that the implementation method (see notifyAcquiredNode(Node) is only called if no timeout has occurred for the associated deploying node.
        Parameters:
        node - the newly added node
        Throws:
        RMException

      • addMultipleDeployingNodes

        protected List<String> addMultipleDeployingNodes(List<String> nodeNames,
                                                 String obfuscatedCmd,
                                                 String message,
                                                 long nodeTimeout)
        Add multiple deploying nodes
        Parameters:
        nodeNames - node names which will be created
        obfuscatedCmd - obfuscated command used to start the node
        message - user message
        nodeTimeout - node timeout used
        Returns:
        a list of deploying nodes urls

      • internalConfigure

        public final void internalConfigure(Object... parameters)
        called by the node source at configuration time. Shifts the parameter array once done to let implementation only care about their own configurable parameters. This method acquires the write lock to manipulate runtime variables.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the parameters of the infrastructure manager
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters are invalid

      • isShutDown

        protected boolean isShutDown()

      • internalShutDown

        public final void internalShutDown()
        Called by the node source at shutdown time. First removes every registered Deploying and Lost nodes and delegates the call to the implementation thanks to the method shutDown()

      • getDescription

        public abstract String getDescription()
        Returns:
        The Description of the implemented Infrastructure

      • configure

        protected abstract void configure(Object... parameters)
        Adds information required to deploy nodes in the future. Do not initiate a real nodes deployment/acquisition as it's up to the policy. The runtime variables of an infrastructure should not be explicitly persisted in this method as the link with the node source is not properly set at the time of calling this method. They will be persisted at the end of the initialization in RMCore#createNodeSource
        Parameters:
        parameters - of the infrastructure manager
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters are invalid

      • reconfigure

        public void reconfigure(Object... updatedInfrastructureParameters)
        Reconfigure the infrastructure of a potentially already deployed node source with the given parameters. Implementations are free to handle override of parameters as they wish.
        Parameters:
        updatedInfrastructureParameters - parameters potentially containing updated dynamic parameters
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if parameters are incorrect
        See Also:
        Configurable.dynamic()

      • acquireNode

        public abstract void acquireNode()
        Asynchronous node acquisition request. Proactive node should be registered by calling internalRegisterAcquiredNode(Node)

      • acquireNodes

        public void acquireNodes(int n,
                         Map<String,?> nodeConfiguration)
        Asynchronous node acquisition request. The request may be skipped if another concurrent request is on-going.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of nodes to acquire
        nodeConfiguration - the configuration for nodes to be acquired

      • acquireNodes

        public void acquireNodes(int n,
                         long timeout,
                         Map<String,?> nodeConfiguration)
        Asynchronous node acquisition request.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of nodes to acquire
        timeout - The maxime waiting time (in milliseconds) before starting to acquire nodes This timeout is used to acquire locks for concurrent deployment if needed. The request will be skipped if it can't be started within the specified timeout.
        nodeConfiguration - the configuration for nodes to be acquired

      • acquireAllNodes

        public abstract void acquireAllNodes()
        Asynchronous request of all nodes acquisition. Proactive nodes should be registered by calling internalRegisterAcquiredNode(Node)

      • acquireAllNodes

        public void acquireAllNodes(Map<String,?> nodeConfiguration)

      • removeNode

        public abstract void removeNode(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
                         throws RMException
        Removes the node from the resource manager.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to release.
        Throws:
        RMException - if any problems occurred.

      • notifyDeployingNodeLost

        protected void notifyDeployingNodeLost(String pnURL)
        Notifies the user that the deploying node was lost or removed (because of a timeout, user interaction...) Default empty implementation is provided because implementors don't necessary use this feature. Anyway, if they decide to do so, they can override this method, for instance, to change a flag that would get a control loop to exit...
        Parameters:
        pnURL - the deploying node's URL for which one the timeout occurred.

      • notifyAcquiredNode

        protected abstract void notifyAcquiredNode(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
                                    throws RMException
        Notifies the implementation of the infrastructure manager that a new node has been registered. If this method throws an exception, the node registration will be discarded. This method is always called if implementor doesn't use deploying nodes (no call to addDeployingNode(String, String, String, long) was made), and is called only for deploying nodes for which one no timeout occurred.
        Parameters:
        node - the newly registered node
        Throws:
        RMException - if the implementation does not approve the node acquisition request

      • shutDown

        protected void shutDown()
        Notify this infrastructure it is going to be shut down along with its nodesource. All necessary cleanup should be done here.

      • persistInfrastructureVariables

        public void persistInfrastructureVariables()
        If nodes recovery is enabled, persist the current state of the node source. If the node source data of this infrastructure is not know, it is first fetched in database. The node source data is never persisted if the current infrastructure is the RMConstants.DEFAULT_LOCAL_NODES_NODE_SOURCE_NAME.

      • setRmDbManager

        protected void setRmDbManager(RMDBManager dbManager)

      • getDefaultCommandLineBuilder

        protected final org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.utils.CommandLineBuilder getDefaultCommandLineBuilder(org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.utils.OperatingSystem targetOS)
        This method returns a CommandLineBuilder filled in with "default" settings. That means that the returned CommandLineBuilder is useable as such.
        • It tries to set the Java Path to use, either JAVA_HOME retrieved from your environment or java.home set by Java itself.
        • The target operating system is set to OperatingSystem.UNIX
        • If a ProActive configuration file is provided, it is used as such.
        • Finally, it tries to set the nodesource's name, the rm's URL and the node's name.
        Parameters:
        targetOS - the operating system on which one the node will be deployed

      • getEmptyCommandLineBuilder

        protected final org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.utils.CommandLineBuilder getEmptyCommandLineBuilder()
        Returns an empty CommandLineBuilder
        Returns:
        Returns an empty CommandLineBuilder

      • addDeployingNode

        protected final String addDeployingNode(String name,
                                        String command,
                                        String description,
                                        long timeout)
        Creates a new RMDeployingNode's, stores it in a local ArrayList and notify the owning NodeSource of the RMDeployingNode creation
        Parameters:
        name - The RMDeployingNode's name.
        description - The RMDeployingNode's description
        timeout - after which one the deploying node will be declared lost. ( node acquisition after this timeout is discarded )
        Returns:
        The newly created RMDeployingNode's URL.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the infrastructure manager is shuting down

      • updateDeployingNodeDescription

        protected final boolean updateDeployingNodeDescription(String toUpdateURL,
                                                       String newDescription)
        To update the description of a deploying node. If a timeout has occurred for this node, the update is discarded.
        Parameters:
        toUpdateURL - The RMDeployingNode's URL whose description will be updated.
        newDescription - The new description
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false if the deploying node is not managed by the IM anymore.

      • declareDeployingNodeLost

        protected final boolean declareDeployingNodeLost(String toUpdateURL,
                                                 String description)
        Declares a deploying node lost. Future attempts to modify the deploying node will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        toUpdateURL - The RMDeployingNode's URL which is to be declared as lost
        description - the new rmdeployingnode's description, can be null.
        Returns:
        true if the method ran successfully, false otherwise.

      • checkNodeIsAcquiredAndDo

        protected final boolean checkNodeIsAcquiredAndDo(String nodeName,
                                                 Runnable toRunWhenOK,
                                                 Runnable toRunWhenKO)
        Check if the Node with the given name is already acquired ( usefull when the launcher of the process which is supposed to launch a RMNode waits for its registration ). At the same time, this methode executes the first runnable is the node has been found amoung acquired nodes and executes the second runnable if the node has not been found. Note that this method is in mutual exclusion with internalRegisterAcquiredNode(Node) to avoid races.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - the node's name
        toRunWhenOK - the Runnable that will be launched if the node is already acquired (can be null)
        toRunWhenKO - the Runnable that will be launched if the node has not been found among nodesource.getAliveNodes(). (can be null)
        Returns:
        true if the node with such name is already acquired false otherwise.

      • checkAllNodesAreAcquiredAndDo

        protected final boolean checkAllNodesAreAcquiredAndDo(List<String> nodeNames,
                                                      Runnable toRunWhenOK,
                                                      Runnable toRunWhenKO)

      • buildDeployingNodeURL

        protected String buildDeployingNodeURL(String pnName)
        Builds the name of the deploying node given its name
        Parameters:
        pnName - The name of the deploying node
        Returns:
        the URL of the deploying node

      • searchForNotAcquiredRmNode

        public RMNode searchForNotAcquiredRmNode(String nodeUrl)
        Look for a RMNode in data structures holding lost and deploying nodes. It does not look into the acquired nodes because this data structure holds instances of Node and thus has no information about the acquired RMNode.
        Parameters:
        nodeUrl -
        Returns:
        a lost or deploying RMNode that could be found using the given URL, or null

      • onDownNodeReconnection

        public void onDownNodeReconnection(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
        Called by the system every time a node that is DOWN reconnects and changes its status to FREE or BUSY.
        Parameters:
        node - the node that has reconnected.

      • update

        public RMDeployingNode update(RMDeployingNode rmNode)
        Updates a deploying node.

        The update is performed on deploying nodes first. If no node if found, lost nodes are considered.

        Parameters:
        rmNode - the new deploying node instance to use.
        Returns:
        the previous value or null.

      • initializePersistedInfraVariables

        protected abstract void initializePersistedInfraVariables()
        This method should initialize a value in the runtime variables map for all the runtime variables that will be used in the class. It is called at initialization time of the infrastructure, just before the configure(Object...) method. This method runs with the write lock acquired.
